Isomorphisms of right quasigroups
To decide if two right quasigroups are isomorphic, &RightQuasigroups; first calculates some isomorphism invariants and a partition invariant under isomorphisms, and then determines if there is an isomorphisms that respects the partition. All isomorphisms between two right quasigroups of size n are returned as permutations of [1..n].
a data structure suitable for isomorphism searches from a right quasigroup Q.
true if the two isomorphism discriminators D1, D2 (each returned by IsomorphismDiscriminator) are equal as discriminators, else returns false. If false is returned, the two disriminators correspond to right quasigroups that are not isomorphic. If true is returned, the corresponding right quasigroups might be isomorphic.
IsomorphismRightQuasigroups, IsomophismQuasigroups, IsomorphismLoops
an isomorphism between the right quasigroups (quasigroups, loops) Q1 and Q2, if one exists, else returns fail. If an isomorphism from Q1 to Q2 exists, it is returned as a permutation of [1..n], where n is the size of Q1 (and hence also the size of Q2).
Right quasigroups up to isomorphism
a sublist of ls consisting of all right quasigroups (quasigroups, loops) in ls up to isomorphism.
It is sometimes useful to work with specific isomorphic copies of algebras. Given a right quasigoup (Q,\cdot) and a permutation f of Q, the isomorphic copy f(Q,\cdot) = (Q,*) is obtained by setting x*y = f(f^{-1}(x)f^{-1}y). Any isomorphic copy of Q is also called isomorphisomorph of Q.
Isomorphic copies
an isomorphic copy of the right quasigroups Q via the permutation f. If Q has size n, the permutation f must be a permutation of [1..n]. The resulting right quasigroup will have the same underlying set as Q and will be index based iff Q is index based.

ManSection.Returns: the automorphism group of the right quasigroup Q as a subgroup of the symmetric group on [1..Size(Q)].

Isotopisms of quasigroups and loops
An isotopismisotopism or right quasigroups (Q_1,\cdot), (Q_2,*) is a triple of bijections \alpha,\beta,\gamma:Q_1\to Q_2 such that \alpha(x)*\beta(y)=\gamma(x\cdot y) for all x,y\in Q_1.
Given a quasigroup (Q,\cdot,/,\backslash) and f,g\in Q, the principal loop isotope principal loop isotope via f,g is defined as (Q,\circ), where x\circ y = (x/f)\cdot(g\backslash y). The principal loop isotope is automatically a loop with neutral element g\cdot f.
Every isotopism of loop can be written as the composition of a principal loop isotopism and an isomorphism.
the loop isotope with multiplication x\circ y = (x/f)\cdot(g\backslash y), where Q is a quasigroup with multiplication \cdot and divisions /, \backslash. The resulting loop will have the same underlying set as Q, will have neutral element g\cdot f, and will be index based iff Q is index based.
IsotopismQuasigroups, IsotopismLoops
an isotopism from the quasigroup (loop) Q1 onto the quasigroup (loop) Q2, if it exists, else returns fail. The isotopism is returned as a triple of permutations on [1..n], where n is the size of Q1 (and hence also the size of Q2).
Quasigroups and loops up to isotopism
a sublist of ls consisting of all quasigroups (loops) in ls up to isotopism.
